intro: Diploclinium angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved diploclinium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
